SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.collection.id

Class IdGenerator

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.collection.id.IdGenerator
public class IdGenerator extends Object
Singleton class for generating unique IDs.

The IdGenerator class is responsible for generating unique incremental IDs and persisting the current state to a file. This ensures IDs remain consistent across application restarts.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • IdGenerator

      private IdGenerator() throws IOException
      Private constructor for initializing the IdGenerator.

      Sets up the file worker to read and write IDs from/to the configured file path and initializes the current ID.

      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during file operations

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static IdGenerator getInstance() throws IOException
      Returns the singleton instance of the IdGenerator.

      If the instance does not already exist, it is created. Otherwise, the existing instance is returned.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of IdGenerator
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during initialization

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the current ID by reading it from the file.

      If the file does not contain a valid ID, the current ID is reset to 0.

    • generateId

      public int generateId() throws IOException
      Generates a new unique ID and saves it to the file.

      The method increments the current ID, persists it to the file, and then returns the new value.

      Returns:
      the newly generated unique ID
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during file operations

    • close

      public void close() throws Exception
      Closes the FileWorker.

      This method ensures proper release of resources used by the file worker.

      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during file closure
